adjective.description: Only one; not one of several.
examples: the kingdom was ruled over by a single family

adjective.description: Unmarried or not involved in a stable sexual relationship.

examples: the studio was a single large room

adjective.description: Free from duplicity or deceit; ingenuous.

noun.description: An individual person or thing rather than part of a pair or a group.
A hit that allows the batter to reach first base safely.
(especially in tennis and badminton) a game or competition for individual players, not pairs or teams.

verb.description: Choose someone or something from a group for special treatment.
examples: one newspaper was singled out for criticism

origin: Middle English: via Old French from Latin singulus, related to simplus simple.
